specificHeat.note: High specific heat capacity, similar to water

latentHeatOfVaporization.note: Very high heat of vaporization due to strong hydrogen bonding

evaporationCoefficient.note: Hertz-Knudsen α coefficient. Very low due to strong hydrogen bonding, high viscosity, and low vapor pressure. Range 0.01-1.0.

antoineCoefficients.TminC_note: EMPIRICALLY VERIFIED RANGE MINIMUM: The Antoine coefficients were experimentally validated down to this temperature. Calculations below this are extrapolated (smooth curve continues, but accuracy may degrade).
antoineCoefficients.TmaxC_note: EMPIRICALLY VERIFIED RANGE MAXIMUM: The Antoine coefficients were experimentally validated up to this temperature. Calculations above this are extrapolated (smooth curve continues, but accuracy may degrade).
antoineCoefficients.source: Published thermodynamic data for glycerin; valid at high temperatures (150-290°C) where vapor pressure becomes measurable.
antoineCoefficients.note: Very low vapor pressure at room temperature; essentially non-volatile

viscosity.note: Extremely viscous; 1400× more viscous than water; thick, syrupy consistency

surfaceTension.note: High surface tension, close to water (72 mN/m)

solubilityInWater.note: Fully miscible with water; forms strong hydrogen bonds

hygroscopicity.note: Highly hygroscopic; absorbs moisture from air; used as humectant in cosmetics and food

sweetness.note: About 60% as sweet as sucrose; used as sweetener in foods
